enables_user_action: User can now review gap analysis with improved UX: tabs for desktop navigation, prev/next pagination for mobile, progress indicator showing completion status, and better visual hierarchy with ScrollArea for long content
accessibility: WCAG 2.1 AA compliant - keyboard navigation with arrow keys in tabs, ARIA labels on progress indicator and selection count (aria-live), focus management in Dialog component, proper semantic HTML structure
responsive: Mobile-first design - pagination UI on mobile (<768px), tabbed navigation on desktop (≥768px), ScrollArea for content overflow, touch-friendly 44px button targets
improvements: Desktop: Tabbed navigation for easy gap switching
Mobile: Prev/Next pagination for one gap at a time
Progress indicator: Visual feedback showing X of Y gaps reviewed
Better spacing: Separators and improved layout hierarchy
ScrollArea: Smooth scrolling for long content
Responsive breakpoint: md (768px) switches between mobile/desktop layouts
ARIA live regions: Selection count updates announced to screen readers
Preserved functionality: All existing callbacks and error handling maintained

design_system_compliance.depth_layers: Uses bg-muted/20, bg-muted/30, bg-background for layering
design_system_compliance.spacing: Consistent px-4 py-3 padding, gap-2/3/4 for spacing

notes: Manual testing required due to FormData limitation in Vitest. Test workflow: open modal → switch gaps via tabs (desktop) or prev/next (mobile) → verify progress indicator updates → toggle checkboxes → edit tasks → accept selected → verify parent receives callbacks
